isis.stitle: RADIATOR, REMOVE AND REPLACE - 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700 Models - RADIATOR REPLACE AND INSTALL

specpara.para: The radiator core is a replaceable component only. If replacing the radiator core, use only authorized International parts and assemblies.

step1.para: Install radiator ground wire.
Install core frame support brackets, align and start frame assembly bolts, then tighten.
Install transmission oil cooler fittings.
Place radiator lower frame in position on floor or work table, to install radiator core.
Place left side of radiator frame assembly in lower frame ( Figure 43, Items 1 and 3) and install lower bolts.
Install core assembly, position and align bolt holes and frame mounting bolts ( Figure 44, Item 2) for side frame and radiator core.
Install remaining bolts and tighten.
Install opposite side frame, align, install, and tighten bolts in side frame.

figure.caption: Figure 45. Radiator Top Frame Mounting Bolt Alignment

step1.para: Install radiator top frame ( Figure 45, Items 2 and 3) and fasten top frame to side frame sections.
Install all remaining frame mounting bolts and tighten.
With an assistant, lift and move radiator assembly to chassis.
Locate radiator on chassis mounting bushings, align the radiator lower mounting bracket bolts ( Figure 38, Item 3) with the crossmember mounting bushing ( Figure 37, Item 2).
Insert bolts through the mounting bushings and frame. Install the lower lock nuts on the mounting bolts.
Tighten radiator mounting bolts, locate and connect stay rod on left side to support radiator assembly.
Position fan shroud around fan drive hub.
Install fan to fan drive hub ( Figure 36, Items 3 and 4).
Connect radiator shroud to radiator frame ( Figure 35, Item 2).
Position radiator shroud center with fan blade. Tighten radiator mounting bolts.
Tighten stay rod at radiator bracket, drivers side.

svcsubproc.title: surge tanks
svcsubproc.para: Check the surge tanks prior to installation for any leaks and or damage.

step1.para: Install the driver side surge tank ( Figure 31). Position tank on radiator top frame and insert mounting bolts. Locate and align lower surge tank mounting bolts and mounting holes ( Figure 29, Item 4). Tighten surge tank mounting bolts. Connect surge tank hoses ( Figure 30, Item 2), and windshield washer fluid hoses, drivers side.
Locate, align, and mount the passenger side surge tank mounting bolts ( Figure 28, Item 1) on the radiator top frame.
Connect low level coolant sensor plug in receptacle.
Connect internal transmission oil cooler lines to radiator ( Figure 26, Item 5).
Connect all surge tank hoses as required.
Connect hood wiring harness to radiator frame, and connect radiator ground wire plug ( Figure 27, Items 3 and 4).

svcsubproc.title: RADIATOR HOSE
svcsubproc.para: Check radiator hoses for any defects and replace when necessary prior to installation.
Place gates heat shrink clamps on each end of radiator hose to be reconnected. Use the following procedure to install Gates Power Grip SB hose clamps.

step1.para: Remove clamp from brace by squeezing band to collapse, then fold in half and remove it from cardboard.
Place clamps over each end of new hose.

figure.caption: Figure 48. Radiator Hose and Shrink Clamps

step1.para: Position hose over fittings.

Slide clamp over top of fitting bead. (Gates Power Grip SB Heat Shrink Clamps have a wider sealing surface than conventional clamps and can be positioned over a wide area including the bead without causing leaks.)

figure.caption: Figure 49. Cross Section Clamp and Hose

important.para: Be sure to position so the print on the clamp is facing up ( Figure 46) and in full view.

step1.para: Apply heat as follows:

step2.para: Use standard heat gun with setting on high.
Do not use open flame to apply heat.
Follow heat gun manufacturer's safety procedures.
Do not apply heat to one spot too long. Move gun continuously.
Move heat gun continuously around as much of the clamps surface as possible - 1/3 of the surface minimum.

caution.para: Although Gates Power Grip Heat Shrink Clamps are very durable, too much heat can melt them.

step2.para: Continue until shrinking is complete (printed information on the clamp will turn gray when enough heat has been applied).

step1.para: To be sure a good seal was made, check connections by trying to turn the hose. Hose and clamp should not turn when using reasonable torque.
Connect lower radiator hose to radiator ( Figure 50, Item 1).
Install Gates Heat Shrink Clamps as directed on each end of replacement radiator hose.
Connect hood wiring harness to radiator frame, passenger side.
Install charge air cooler ( Figure 51).

With the help of an assistant, place charge air cooler in position and swing passenger side around ( Figure 18) to clear radiator side frame and align the lower mounting bolt hole in the radiator frame assembly.
Insert the mounting bolt each side and tighten.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. CHARGE AIR COOLER MOUNTING BOLT (PASSENGER SIDE SHOWN)

step1.para: Install the upper radiator hose utilizing the Gates Power Grip SB Heat Shrink Clamps ( Figure 52).

figure.caption: Figure 52. Upper Radiator Hose Install With Gates Power Grip SB Heat Shrink Clamps

step1.para: Install the upper recirculation shield ( Figure 17, Item 1).
Install A/C condenser, mounting bracket and mounting bracket bolts, securing brackets to radiator frame.
Connect condenser lines to mounting clip on shroud, if applicable.
Install passenger side radiator support stay rod.
Locate, align and mount the drivers side recirculation shield. Tighten all mounting bolts.
Install passenger side recirculation shield and attach condenser lines P-clip ( Figure 53, Item 2) to the recirculation shield, if applicable.

figure.caption: Figure 53. A/C Condenser Line Clip Attachment

svcsubproc.title: CHARGE AIR COOLER PIPES
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installation of charge air cooler pipes, inspect pipes for dirt or particles. Remove any dirt or particles.

step1.para: Place charge air cooler clamps on pipe connections.
Tighten the spring tension clamps on each end of the charge air cooler piping to the appropriate port on the turbo charger and components.
Install passenger side splash panel and connect air horn air line, if applicable.
Connect hood stop cables each side.
Replace coolant after all other installations have been completed.
Replace windshield washer fluid as may be necessary.
After all other installations are completed, including surge tank and related components, and charge air cooler, reconnect battery, and start engine.
With engine running check all connections for leaks.
If leaks occur, shut down engine, and use heat gun to apply additional heat to the Gates Power Grip Heat Shrink Clamps. Restart engine and check for leaks again.
If no leaks show, close hood and set adjustment on hood assembly.
To adjust the hood assembly, slide hood back to original position and check alignment. Tighten the hood support mounting bracket bolts and hinge bolts as necessary.

svcsubproc.para: Install the grille assembly ( Figures 1 and 2).

step1.para: Remove wheel chocks.
